name: menu
summary: The `<menu>` HTML element is a semantic alternative to ul. It represents an unordered list of items (represented by li elements), each of which represents a link or other command that the user can activate.
contentCategories: Flow content. If the element's children include at least one li element: Palpable content.
permittedContent: Zero or more occurrences of li, script, and template.
permittedParents: Any element that accepts flow content.
permittedAriaRoles: directory, group, listbox, menu, menubar, none, presentation, radiogroup, tablist, toolbar or tree
